Type.Name: XmlNameTable
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Creates a table that stores unique instances of objects.

remarks.para: Only a single instance of any given string is stored even if the string is added multiple times to the table.

Using this class provides an efficient means for an XML parser to use the same object for all repeated element and attribute names in an XML document. If the same object is used for all repeated names, the efficiency of name comparisons is increased by allowing the names to be compared using object comparisons rather than string comparisons.

block.para: This class is and is implemented in the class.

example.para: See the class for an example using this class.

Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string Add(string array)

summary.para: Adds the specified to the table if a instance with the same value does not already exist in the table.

returns.para: , if it did not exist in the table at the time of the call, or the instance previously stored in the table with a value equal to .

para.block: Only a single instance of any given is stored in the table. If the value of is already stored in the table, the instance with that value is returned.
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string Add(class System.Char[] array, int32 offset, int32 length)
public abstract string Add (char[] buffer, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: A specifying the zero-based index into the array of the first character of the string.
A containing the number of characters in the string.

summary.para: Adds the equivalent of a specified subset of a array to the table if the string equivalent does not already exist in the table.

returns.para: The equivalent of the specified subset of the array that is stored in the table, or if is zero.

para.block: Only a single instance of any given is stored in the table. Calling this method with the same subset (containing the same characters) of any array, returns the same instance of the equivalent.
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

exception.para: The above conditions do not cause an exception to be thrown if = 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string Get(string array)

summary.para: Looks up the value of the specified in the table.

returns.para: The instance previously stored in the table with a value equal to , or if it does not exist.

para.block: Only a single instance of any given is stored in the table. If the value of is already stored in the table, the instance with that value is returned.
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string Get(class System.Char[] array, int32 offset, int32 length)
public abstract string Get (char[] buffer, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: A specifying the zero-based index into the array of the first character of the string.
A containing the number of characters in the string.

summary.para: Looks up the equivalent of a specified subset of a array in the table.

returns.para: The equivalent of the specified subset of the array that is stored in the table, or if the equivalent is not in the table.

para.block: Only a single instance of any given is stored in the table. Calling this method with the same subset (containing the same characters) of any array, returns the same instance of the equivalent, if it exists.
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.
